verses.kjv: And when the people complained, it displeased the LORD: and the LORD heard it; and his anger was kindled; and the fire of the LORD burnt among them, and consumed them that were in the uttermost parts of the camp.
verses.ct: The people started complaining, and the LORD was displeased when he heard it. His anger burned, and fire from the LORD blazed among them, destroying those on the outskirts of the camp.

verses.kjv: And the people cried unto Moses; and when Moses prayed unto the LORD, the fire was quenched.
verses.ct: The people cried out to Moses, and when Moses prayed to the LORD, the fire died down.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of the place Taberah: because the fire of the LORD burnt among them.
verses.ct: That place was named Taberah, because fire from the LORD had blazed among them.

verses.kjv: And the mixt multitude that was among them fell a lusting: and the children of Israel also wept again, and said, Who shall give us flesh to eat?
verses.ct: The foreigners mixed in among them began craving other food, and the Israelites started crying again too, saying, "Who is going to give us meat to eat?

verses.kjv: We remember the fish, which we did eat in Egypt freely; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions, and the garlick:
verses.ct: "We remember the fish we used to eat for free in Egypt — the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.

verses.kjv: But now our soul is dried away: there is nothing at all, beside this manna, before our eyes.
verses.ct: But now our appetite is gone. There's absolutely nothing to look at except this manna."

verses.kjv: And the manna was as coriander seed, and the colour thereof as the colour of bdellium.
verses.ct: The manna looked like coriander seeds and had the appearance of bdellium resin.

verses.kjv: And the people went about, and gathered it, and ground it in mills, or beat it in a mortar, and baked it in pans, and made cakes of it: and the taste of it was as the taste of fresh oil.
verses.ct: The people would go around collecting it, then grind it in hand mills or crush it in a mortar. They would cook it in pots or make flat cakes from it. It tasted like something made with fresh olive oil.

verses.kjv: And when the dew fell upon the camp in the night, the manna fell upon it.
verses.ct: When the dew settled on the camp at night, the manna would come down with it.

verses.kjv: Then Moses heard the people weep throughout their families, every man in the door of his tent: and the anger of the LORD was kindled greatly; Moses also was displeased.
verses.ct: Moses could hear the people weeping, family after family, each person standing at the entrance of their tent. The LORD's anger burned intensely, and Moses was deeply troubled as well.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, Wherefore hast thou afflicted thy servant? and wherefore have I not found favour in thy sight, that thou layest the burden of all this people upon me?
verses.ct: Moses said to the LORD, "Why have you brought this trouble on your servant? Why haven't I earned your favor, that you've placed the weight of all these people on me?

verses.kjv: Have I conceived all this people? have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father beareth the sucking child, unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers?
verses.ct: Did I conceive all these people? Did I give birth to them? Yet you tell me to carry them close to my chest, like a nurse carries an infant, all the way to the land you promised their ancestors?

verses.kjv: Whence should I have flesh to give unto all this people? for they weep unto me, saying, Give us flesh, that we may eat.
verses.ct: Where am I supposed to get meat for all these people? They keep crying to me, saying, 'Give us meat to eat!'

verses.kjv: I am not able to bear all this people alone, because it is too heavy for me.
verses.ct: I can't carry all these people by myself — it's too much for me.

verses.kjv: And if thou deal thus with me, kill me, I pray thee, out of hand, if I have found favour in thy sight; and let me not see my wretchedness.
verses.ct: If this is how you're going to treat me, then please just kill me right now — if I've earned any favor with you — and don't let me go on facing this misery."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Gather unto me seventy men of the elders of Israel, whom thou knowest to be the elders of the people, and officers over them; and bring them unto the tabernacle of the congregation, that they may stand there with thee.
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Bring together 70 men from Israel's elders — people you know to be leaders and officials among the people — and take them to the tent of meeting so they can stand there with you.

verses.kjv: And I will come down and talk with thee there: and I will take of the spirit which is upon thee, and will put it upon them; and they shall bear the burden of the people with thee, that thou bear it not thyself alone.
verses.ct: I will come down and speak with you there. I will take some of the spirit that is on you and place it on them. They will share the burden of the people with you so that you won't have to carry it alone.

verses.kjv: And say thou unto the people, Sanctify yourselves against to morrow, and ye shall eat flesh: for ye have wept in the ears of the LORD, saying, Who shall give us flesh to eat? for it was well with us in Egypt: therefore the LORD will give you flesh, and ye shall eat.
verses.ct: Then tell the people: 'Prepare yourselves for tomorrow, because you will eat meat. You have been crying in the LORD's hearing, saying, "Who will give us meat to eat? Life was better for us in Egypt." So the LORD will give you meat, and you will eat it.

verses.kjv: Ye shall not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days;
verses.ct: You won't eat it for just 1 day, or 2 days, or 5 days, or 10 days, or even 20 days.

verses.kjv: But even a whole month, until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome unto you: because that ye have despised the LORD which is among you, and have wept before him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt?
verses.ct: You'll eat it for an entire month, until it comes out of your nostrils and you're completely disgusted by it — because you have rejected the LORD who is right here among you, and you have cried in his presence, saying, "Why did we ever leave Egypt?"'

verses.kjv: And Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand footmen; and thou hast said, I will give them flesh, that they may eat a whole month.
verses.ct: Moses replied, "The people I'm with number 600,000 on foot, and you're saying, 'I will give them meat to eat for a whole month'?

verses.kjv: Shall the flocks and the herds be slain for them, to suffice them? or shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to suffice them?
verses.ct: Even if all the flocks and herds were slaughtered, would that be enough for them? Even if all the fish in the sea were caught, would that satisfy them?"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Is the LORD’s hand waxed short? thou shalt see now whether my word shall come to pass unto thee or not.
verses.ct: The LORD responded to Moses, "Has the LORD's power become limited? Now you will see whether or not what I've said will happen."

verses.kjv: And Moses went out, and told the people the words of the LORD, and gathered the seventy men of the elders of the people, and set them round about the tabernacle.
verses.ct: So Moses went out and told the people what the LORD had said. He gathered 70 of the elders and positioned them around the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: And the LORD came down in a cloud, and spake unto him, and took of the spirit that was upon him, and gave it unto the seventy elders: and it came to pass, that, when the spirit rested upon them, they prophesied, and did not cease.
verses.ct: Then the LORD came down in a cloud and spoke to him. He took some of the spirit that was on Moses and placed it on the 70 elders. When the spirit rested on them, they prophesied — though they did not do so again after that.

verses.kjv: But there remained two of the men in the camp, the name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad: and the spirit rested upon them; and they were of them that were written, but went not out unto the tabernacle: and they prophesied in the camp.
verses.ct: However, 2 men had stayed behind in the camp — one named Eldad and the other named Medad. The spirit rested on them too. They had been listed among the chosen elders but hadn't gone out to the tent, and they prophesied right there in the camp.

verses.kjv: And there ran a young man, and told Moses, and said, Eldad and Medad do prophesy in the camp.
verses.ct: A young man ran to Moses and reported, "Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!"

verses.kjv: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Moses, one of his young men, answered and said, My lord Moses, forbid them.
verses.ct: Joshua son of Nun, who had served Moses since he was young, spoke up and said, "My lord Moses, you need to stop them!"

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto him, Enviest thou for my sake? would God that all the LORD’s people were prophets, and that the LORD would put his spirit upon them!
verses.ct: But Moses replied, "Are you jealous on my behalf? I wish that all of the LORD's people were prophets and that the LORD would place his spirit on every one of them!"

verses.kjv: And Moses gat him into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: Then Moses returned to the camp, along with the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: And there went forth a wind from the LORD, and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, as it were a day’s journey on this side, and as it were a day’s journey on the other side, round about the camp, and as it were two cubits high upon the face of the earth.
verses.ct: A wind sent by the LORD swept in quail from the sea and dropped them all around the camp. They covered the ground for about a day's journey in every direction from the camp, piled about 3 feet deep on the surface of the ground.

verses.kjv: And the people stood up all that day, and all that night, and all the next day, and they gathered the quails: he that gathered least gathered ten homers: and they spread them all abroad for themselves round about the camp.
verses.ct: The people were on their feet all that day, all night, and all the next day gathering quail. The person who collected the least still gathered about 60 bushels. They spread them out all around the camp to dry.

verses.kjv: And while the flesh was yet between their teeth, ere it was chewed, the wrath of the LORD was kindled against the people, and the LORD smote the people with a very great plague.
verses.ct: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before they had even finished chewing, the LORD's anger blazed against the people, and the LORD struck them with a devastating plague.

verses.kjv: And he called the name of that place Kibrothhattaavah: because there they buried the people that lusted.
verses.ct: That place was named Kibroth-hattaavah, because that is where they buried the people who had given in to their cravings.

verses.kjv: And the people journeyed from Kibrothhattaavah unto Hazeroth; and abode at Hazeroth.
verses.ct: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth, and they stayed at Hazeroth.
